types.name: AbstractRedisClientExpected
types.doc:
This class serves as a placeholder for a possible redis client and the specific methods we rely on.

Any redis client used must define these methods.
types.summary: This class serves as a placeholder for a possible redis client and the specific methods we rely on.

instance_methods.name: get
instance_methods.doc: Get the value for a key.

instance_methods.name: set
instance_methods.doc:
Set the value for a key.

```
redis_client = MyRedisClient.new
redis_client.set("my_key", "my_value") # =>
```

types.name: MyDemoApp
types.doc:
This is the class for my demo app! :)

```
require "./my_demo_app"

my_app = MyDemoApp.new
my_app.random_key_store # => "some_random_key"
```
types.summary: This is the class for my demo app! :)

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
This expects a class that represents some kind of redis client.

See `AbstractRedisClientExpected` for the required method definitions.
constructors.summary: This expects a class that represents some kind of redis client.

instance_methods.name: random_key_store
instance_methods.doc:
This will let you set a random key/value pair.

Why not? ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è It's a demo after all! üòÅ
instance_methods.summary: This will let you set a random key/value pair.

instance_methods.name: set_an_exact_value
instance_methods.doc: This will let you set an exact key/value pair.
instance_methods.summary: This will let you set an exact key/value pair.

instance_methods.name: what_was_that?
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method if you forgot the value that was stored for a key.

This won't help if you've forgotten your key üòâ
instance_methods.summary: Use this method if you forgot the value that was stored for a key.
